use_synthetic.description: Whether to use synthetic data. Defaults to False.

synthetic_num_unique_samples.description: The number of unique samples to allocate memory for.

synthetic_device.description: Device to store the sample pool. Should be `cuda` or `cpu`. Defauls to `cpu`.

synthetic_memory_format.description: Memory format. Defaults to contiguous format.

drop_last.description:
If the number of samples is not divisible by the batch size,
whether to drop the last batch (the default) or pad the last batch with zeros.

shuffle.description: Whether to shuffle the dataset for each epoch. Defaults to True.

split.description: Which split of the dataset to use. Either ['train', 'val', 'test']

base_size.description: Initial size of the image and target before other augmentations

min_resize_scale.description: Minimum value that the image and target can be scaled

max_resize_scale.description: Maximum value that the image and target can be scaled

final_size.description: Final size of the image and target

ignore_background.description: If true, ignore the background class in training loss

datadir.description: The path to the data directory

split.description: Which split of the dataset to use. Either ['train', 'val']

drop_last.description: Whether to drop the last samples for the last batch.

shuffle.description: Whether to shuffle the samples in the dataset. Currently, shards are assigned and consumed with deterministic per-device shard order, but shuffling affects the order of samples via (per-device) shuffle buffers.

split.description: What split of the dataset to use. Either `train` or `validation`.

num_samples.description: The number of post-processed token samples, used to set epoch size of the IterableDataset.

tokenizer_name.description: The name of the HuggingFace tokenizer to preprocess text with.

max_seq_len.description: The max sequence length of each token sample.

group_method.description: How to group text samples into token samples. Either `truncate` or `concat`.

mlm.description: Whether or not to use masked language modeling.

mlm_probability.description: If `mlm==True`, the probability that tokens are masked.

shuffle_buffer_size.description: If `shuffle=True`, samples are read into a buffer of this size (per-device), and randomly sampled from there to produce shuffled samples.

seed.description: If `shuffle=True`, what seed to use for shuffling operations.

drop_last.description:
If the number of samples is not divisible by the batch size,
whether to drop the last batch (the default) or pad the last batch with zeros.

shuffle.description: Whether to shuffle the dataset for each epoch. Defaults to True.

remote.description: Remote directory (S3 or local filesystem) where dataset is stored

local.description: Local filesystem directory where dataset is cached during operation

split.description: What split of the dataset to use. Either `train` or `val`.

tokenizer_name.description: The name of the HuggingFace tokenizer to preprocess text with.

max_seq_len.description: The max sequence length of each token sample.

group_method.description: How to group text samples into token samples. Currently only `truncate` is supported.

mlm.description: Whether or not to use masked language modeling.

mlm_probability.description: If `mlm==True`, the probability that tokens are masked.

max_retries.description: Number of download re-attempts before giving up.

timeout.description: How long to wait for shard to download before raising an exception.

train_batch_size.description: batch size for each optimization step, across all devices and gradient accumulations.

reset_time.description:
Whether to reset the :attr:`.State.timestamp` to zero values. Defaults to False.
If ``True``, the timestamp will be zeroed out, causing :class:`.ComposerScheduler` and
:class:`.Algorithm` instances to start from the beginning, as if it is a new training run. The model
will be trained for ``duration``, if specified, or for :attr:`.State.max_duration`, which would have
been provided when constructing the :class:`.Trainer` or by a previous call to :meth:`.fit`.

.. note::

    Model gradients, optimizer states, and native PyTorch schedulers will not be reset.

If ``False`` (the default), training time will be incremented from where the previous call to
:meth:`.fit` finished (or from zero, if a new training run).
The :attr:`~.State.max_duration` will be incremented by the ``duration`` parameter.

duration.description:
The duration to train. Can be an integer, which will be
interpreted to be epochs, a str (e.g. ``1ep``, or ``10ba``), or a :class:`.Time` object.

If ``reset_time`` is False (the default), then :attr:`.State.max_duration` will be converted
into the same units as this parameter (if necessary), and then the max duration incremented by the
value of this parameter.

If ``reset_time`` is True, then :attr:`.State.max_duration` will be set to this parameter.

step_size.description: Time between changes to the learning rate.

milestones.description: Times at which the learning rate should change.

t_max.description: The duration of this scheduler. Default = ``"1dur"``.
The duration of this scheduler. Default = ``"1dur"``.

alpha_f.description: Learning rate multiplier to decay to. Default = ``0.0``.

t_0.description: The period of the first cycle.

t_mult.description: The multiplier for the duration of successive cycles. Default = ``1.0``.

alpha_f.description: Learning rate multiplier to decay to. Default = ``0.0``.

alpha.description: Learning rate multiplier to maintain while this scheduler is active. Default = ``1.0``.

power.description: The exponent to be used for the proportionality relationship.

t_max.description: The duration of this scheduler. Default = ``"1dur"``.

alpha_f.description: Learning rate multiplier to decay to. Default = ``0.0``.

power.description: The exponent to be used for the proportionality relationship. Default = ``2.0``.

t_max.description: The duration of this scheduler. Default = ``"1dur"``.

alpha_f.description: Learning rate multiplier to decay to. Default = ``0.0``.

scale_warmup.description: SSR also scales the warmup period. Default = ``False``.

milestones.description: Times at which the learning rate should change.

scale_warmup.description: SSR also scales the warmup period. Default = ``False``.

alpha.description: Learning rate multiplier to maintain while this scheduler is active. Default = ``1.0``.

scale_warmup.description: SSR also scales the warmup period. Default = ``False``.

t_max.description: The duration of this scheduler. Default = ``"1dur"``.

scale_warmup.description: SSR also scales the warmup period. Default = ``False``.

t_max.description: The duration of this scheduler. Default = ``"1dur"``.

alpha_f.description: Learning rate multiplier to decay to. Default = ``0.0``.

scale_warmup.description: SSR also scales the warmup period. Default = ``False``.

scale_schedule_ratio.description: Ratio by which to scale the training duration and learning rate schedules.

use_synthetic.description: Whether to use synthetic data. Defaults to False.

synthetic_num_unique_samples.description: The number of unique samples to allocate memory for.

synthetic_device.description: Device to store the sample pool. Should be `cuda` or `cpu`. Defauls to `cpu`.

synthetic_memory_format.description: Memory format. Defaults to contiguous format.

If the number of samples is not divisible by the batch size,

split.description: Which split of the dataset to use. Either ['train', 'val', 'test']

max_resize_scale.description: Maximum value that the image and target can be scaled

final_size.description: Final size of the image and target

ignore_background.description: If true, ignore the background class in training loss

is_train.description: Whether to load the training data (the default) or validation data.

datadir.description: The path to the data directory

drop_last.description:
If the number of samples is not divisible by the batch size,
whether to drop the last batch (the default) or pad the last batch with zeros.

shuffle.description: Whether to shuffle the dataset for each epoch. Defaults to True.

remote.description: Remote directory (S3 or local filesystem) where dataset is stored

local.description: Local filesystem directory where dataset is cached during operation

split.description: Which split of the dataset to use. Either ['train', 'val']

resize_size.description: Resize size. Set to -1 to not resize

use_synthetic.description: Whether to use synthetic data. Defaults to False.

synthetic_num_unique_samples.description: The number of unique samples to allocate memory for.

synthetic_device.description: Device to store the sample pool. Should be `cuda` or `cpu`. Defauls to `cpu`.

synthetic_memory_format.description: Memory format. Defaults to contiguous format.

num_tokens.description: If desired, the number of tokens to truncate the dataset to.

mlm_probability.description: If using masked language modeling, the probability to mask tokens with.

seed.description: Which seed to use to generate train and validation splits.

subsample_ratio.description: If desired, the percentage of the dataset to use.

max_seq_length.description: Optionally, the ability to set a custom sequence length for the training dataset.

task.description: The GLUE task to train on, choose one from: CoLA, MNLI, MRPC, QNLI, QQP, RTE, SST-2, and STS-B.

tokenizer_name.description: The name of the HuggingFace tokenizer to preprocess text with.

split.description: Whether to use 'train', 'validation' or 'test' split.

max_seq_length.description: Optionally, the ability to set a custom sequence length for the training dataset.

shuffle.description: Whether to shuffle the dataset for each epoch. Defaults to True.

remote.description: Remote directory (S3 or local filesystem) where dataset is stored

local.description: Local filesystem directory where dataset is cached during operation

split.description: Which split of the dataset to use. Either ['train', 'val']

drop_last.description: Whether to drop the last samples for the last batch.

shuffle.description: Whether to shuffle the samples in the dataset. Currently, shards are assigned and consumed with deterministic per-device shard order, but shuffling affects the order of samples via (per-device) shuffle buffers.

split.description: What split of the dataset to use. Either `train` or `validation`.

num_samples.description: The number of post-processed token samples, used to set epoch size of the IterableDataset.

tokenizer_name.description: The name of the HuggingFace tokenizer to preprocess text with.

max_seq_len.description: The max sequence length of each token sample.

group_method.description: How to group text samples into token samples. Either `truncate` or `concat`.

mlm.description: Whether or not to use masked language modeling.

mlm_probability.description: If `mlm==True`, the probability that tokens are masked.

shuffle_buffer_size.description: If `shuffle=True`, samples are read into a buffer of this size (per-device), and randomly sampled from there to produce shuffled samples.

seed.description: If `shuffle=True`, what seed to use for shuffling operations.

drop_last.description:
If the number of samples is not divisible by the batch size,
whether to drop the last batch (the default) or pad the last batch with zeros.

shuffle.description: Whether to shuffle the dataset for each epoch. Defaults to True.

remote.description: Remote directory (S3 or local filesystem) where dataset is stored

local.description: Local filesystem directory where dataset is cached during operation

split.description: What split of the dataset to use. Either `train` or `val`.

tokenizer_name.description: The name of the HuggingFace tokenizer to preprocess text with.

max_seq_len.description: The max sequence length of each token sample.

group_method.description: How to group text samples into token samples. Currently only `truncate` is supported.

mlm.description: Whether or not to use masked language modeling.

mlm_probability.description: If `mlm==True`, the probability that tokens are masked.

max_retries.description: Number of download re-attempts before giving up.

timeout.description: How long to wait for shard to download before raising an exception.

eval_interval.description:
An integer,
which will be interpreted to be epochs, a str (e.g. ``1ep``, or ``10ba``), a :class:`.Time` object, or a callable.
Defaults to ``None``, which means that the ``eval_interval`` parameter from the :class:`.Trainer` will be used.

If an integer (in epochs), :class:`.Time` string, or :class:`.Time` instance, the evaluator will be run
with this frequency. :class:`.Time` strings or :class:`.Time` instances must have units of
:attr:`.TimeUnit.BATCH` or :attr:`.TimeUnit.EPOCH`.

Set to ``0`` to disable evaluation.

If a callable, it should take two arguments (:class:`.State`, :class:`.Event`) and return a bool
representing whether the evaluator should be invoked. The event will be either :attr:`.Event.BATCH_END`
or :attr:`.Event.EPOCH_END`.

When specifying ``eval_interval``, the evaluator(s) are also run at the ``Event.FIT_END`` if it doesn't
evenly divide the training duration.

subset_num_batches.description:
The maximum number of batches to use for each evaluation. Defaults to ``None``,
which means that the ``eval_subset_num_batches`` parameter from the :class:`.Trainer` will be used.
Set to ``-1`` to evaluate the entire ``dataloader``

metric_names.description:
Name of the metrics for the evaluator. Can be a torchmetrics metric name or the
        class name of a metric returned by model.metrics(). If None (the default), uses all metrics in the model

eval_batch_size.description: batch size to use for each evaluation step
